001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
011
012import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Coordinates.DuplicateResolution;
013
014/**
015 * A simple empirical function defined by a set of (x,y) coordinates.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface describes a simple empirical function defined by a set of
019 * (x,y) coordinates. It includes parameters for interpolation and link function
020 * transformations. Implementations are used when defining empirical functions
021 * such as the age contact odds function in
022 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.AgeStratifiedDemography}.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Downstream uses include any place where an empirical function is required,
026 * such as the age contact odds function in
027 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.AgeStratifiedDemography}. The default
028 * interpolation method is cubic spline, but other methods may be used if
029 * desired.
030 *
031 * @author Rob Challen
032 */
033@Value.Immutable
034@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.class)
035@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.class)
036public interface EmpiricalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction {
037
038        /**
039         * Compute the differential of the empirical function at a given X value.
040         * <p>
041         * This method computes the differential of the empirical function at a given
042         * X by applying the chain rule to the interpolated value and its derivative.
043         * It uses the derivative of the link function and the derivative of the
044         * interpolator to compute the overall differential at the specified X.
045         *
046         * @param x the X value at which to compute the differential of the empirical
047         *          function
048         * @return the differential of the empirical function at the specified X
049         */
050        @Override
051        default double differential(double x) {
052                return this.getLink().derivInvFn(this.getInterpolator().interpolate(x))
053                                * this.getInterpolator().differential(x);
054
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * The interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
059         * coordinates.
060         *
061         * @return the interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
062         *         coordinates
063         */
064        @Value.Default
065        default Interpolators getInterpolationType() {
066                return Interpolators.CUBIC_SPLINE;
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * The interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation type.
071         * <p>
072         * This method constructs an interpolator based on the (x,y) coordinates and
073         * the specified interpolation type. It applies the link function to the Y
074         * coordinates before interpolation. The resulting interpolator can be used
075         * to compute interpolated values for any X within the range of the
076         * coordinates.
077         *
078         * @return the interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation
079         *         type
080         */
081        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
082        default Interpolator getInterpolator() {
083
084                Coordinates tmp = ImmutableCoordinates.builder().setX(this.getX())
085                                .setY(this.getY()).setXMin(this.getMinimum())
086                                .setXMax(this.getMaximum()).setXLink(LinkFunction.NONE)
087                                .setYLink(this.getLink()).setIncreasing(false)
088                                .setResolveDuplicates(DuplicateResolution.MEAN).build();
089
090                return this.getInterpolationType().create(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
091
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * The link function used to transform the Y coordinates before
096         * interpolation.
097         *
098         * @return the link function used to transform the Y coordinates before
099         *         interpolation
100         */
101        @Value.Default
102        default LinkFunction getLink() { return LinkFunction.NONE; }
103
104        /**
105         * The maximum X value of the empirical function, derived from the
106         * coordinates.
107         *
108         * @return the maximum X value of the empirical function
109         */
110        @Value.Default
111        default double getMaximum() {
112                return Arrays.stream(this.getX()).max().getAsDouble();
113        }
114
115        /**
116         * The minimum X value of the empirical function, derived from the
117         * coordinates.
118         *
119         * @return the minimum X value of the empirical function
120         */
121        @Value.Default
122        default double getMinimum() {
123                return Arrays.stream(this.getX()).min().getAsDouble();
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the empirical function.
128         *
129         * @return the X coordinates defining the empirical function
130         */
131        double[] getX();
132
133        /**
134         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the empirical function.
135         *
136         * @return the Y coordinates defining the empirical function
137         */
138        double[] getY();
139
140        /**
141         * Evaluate the empirical function at a given X value.
142         * <p>
143         * This method computes the value of the empirical function at a given X by
144         * interpolating the Y values at the coordinates and then applying the
145         * inverse link function to the interpolated value. The result is the value
146         * of the empirical function at the specified X.
147         *
148         * @param x the X value at which to evaluate the empirical function
149         * @return the value of the empirical function at the specified X
150         *
151         */
152        @Override
153        default double value(double x) {
154                return this.getLink().invFn(this.getInterpolator().interpolate(x));
155        }
156
157}
